snippet: His total number of interviews -- 408 times -- is higher than his predecessors', but he relatively rarely takes questions at photo opportunities and the like.
abstract: His total number of interviews -- 408 times -- is higher than his predecessors', but he relatively rarely takes questions at photo opportunities and the like.
lead_paragraph: President Obama grants many more media interviews than his predecessors, but holds far fewer impromptu question-and-answer sessions, according to data compiled by a professor who studies presidential interactions with the press.

headline.main: Obama Favors Interviews Over Impromptu Q.&A.'s, Study Finds
